sentence.Network_en: He wants to be seen as less bossy and high-handed.

sentence.Network_en: When we're out he gets really bossy and starts ordering me around.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我们在外面的时候，他变得很爱发号施令，开始不停地让我干这干那。

sentence.Network_cn: 她记得自己曾是一个颇为专横的小姑娘。

entry.tran: 爱发号施令的；好指挥人的
entry.def: If you describe someone as bossy, you mean that they enjoy telling people what to do.

example.ex: She remembers being a rather bossy little girl.
example.tran: 她记得自己曾是一个颇为专横的小姑娘。

means.word_mean: 1. offensively self-assured or given to exercising usually unwarranted power;
